intro: Psychotria papuana, commonly known as the Papuan Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Indonesia, particularly New Guinea. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy green surface. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and often have a distinctive purple or red coloration.
